I learned a lot from field trips.

I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Aaron Benjamin Lefland  Aaron was awesome.
Instructor: Aaron Benjamin Lefland  Aaron Lefland

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Aaron Benjamin Lefland  There were many gaps in information shared, and Aaron was always available and willing to help. He did an amazing job of fulfilling more than he was supposed to.

Instructor: Aaron Benjamin Lefland  Without the help of Aaron as our teaching assistant, I do not think that this class would have been possible. Our instructor was unorganized, not reliably available via email, and not always aware of what topics the students needed help with. I believe that Aaron went above and beyond the required duties of a teaching assistant.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Philip is great at explaining things, but that stopped halfway through the semester. The second half of the course was disorganized and we did not get any feedback on our work until the final product. Due dates were unclear and subjective, information was not communicated clearly about when things were happening, and we still do not know when a final draft of our product is due.

I believe that this course is designed to provide second year students, or those with amble experience, the opportunity to bring together their skills to create a professional products for a client. It combines sampling and design, fieldwork, GIS, writing, social assessments, and interacting with landowners all while working as a member of a team. I understand that the course provides us the opportunity to apply our skills, however, I felt that not all of the topics necessary to create a management plan were covered in depth by the instructor.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: My group
The opportunity to work in a team combining our skills and experience to create a useful management plan for a client. For the most part, the syllabus was followed closely.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Organization and clarity in teaching

There was no formal feedback from the instructor regarding the written part of our plan throughout the semester. Our only feedback from the instructor were edits given 2 days before the draft was due to our landowner. For this reason, I feel that our management plan could be seriously lacking in some topics because were were not given enough time to incorporate the edits or are unaware of what our plan is lacking.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course is one of the requirements for my degree program.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn about how to create a management plan. I did - but only because my group knew. Suggestions felt ill-informed

As a Master of Forestry candidate, knowing how to create a forest management plan is essential to my future career. I will need to know how to create and/or interpret a forest management plan at some point in the future.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Mediocre
No, I feel like I didn't learn as much from this course as students who took this course under Mark Ashton did. The instructor did not challenge us or provide enough feedback.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: As I said, this was the best part of the course. However since we did not get clear instruction, there are many pieces I feel I missed out on learning.
I have already answered this question in detail in my previous answers.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Try to do things that you are not good at
I would go over your sampling design in detail with the instructor or TA before conducting your fieldwork. Be diligent in asking for feedback and comments on your plan throughout the entire semester.
